instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi

Board is not turn power on,not sign of liquite , user said power off suddenly.

When i check voltage

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.42V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> : 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> : 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0V

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is creating <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0V and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> : 0V. When i check this part <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v but <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v . its come from <CHIP>U0500</CHIP> but <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is ok.

how can i check next step ..

Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 0V and <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is high then something around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> must be wrong. 3v3 bus shorted, dead <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: thank you duke when i injected 1.5v PP3v3 line found damaged capasitor and removed it everytings seems ok.
